website_summaries.verdict: Eyewear retainer that offers an adjustable size, but without a tail hanging off the back.
pros: Gives you the ability to adjust the length of the strap between 10" and 21"
Adjustable strap is doubled up, rather than leaving a tail, which can bounce uncomfortably against the skin
cons: Difficult to obtain a tight fit for your eyeglasses around your head

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last year to keep my sunglasses from riding down my nose when I hike and sweat but with all the sweating, the color faded and got nasty even though I rinsed it regularly. I bought this one and am trying to rinse it more often but the color is already changing a little in certain points. It comes with the territory I guess. I use it for hiking so it gets tested and sweated in quite a bit. Another reason I like this is that I can take my sunglasses off and leave them around my neck if I am overheating, want to see something without them or it's not bright enough yet.
customer_reviews.author: akas

customer_reviews.title: Well, I should have paid attention to previous reviews - I just didn’t want to believe them...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I should have paid attention to previous reviews. So while the chums are lightweight, they absolutely fail in two important areas. First, so while they are adjustable, they are too long to provide a tight fit against the head when wearing glasses during active sports. And second, unless you have very narrow glass stems, these will not work for you. They will only accommodate narrow ear pieces. Keep looking if you want something that will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: The retainer I should've bought from the beginning.
customer_reviews.text: I've been through countless glasses retainers and all of them have had their shortcomings. Either the piece that attaches to the arm wasn't tight enough, or the retainer was too long, etc. These are perfect! Super tight fit around my Costa's, nice soft material that doesn't bother the back of my neck, adjustability to fit over my head with a cap on but still be able to tighten up when doing something that would cause them to blow off. I plan on using these until they fall apart and replacing with another pair! ***If you found this review helpful in anyway, let me know by clicking "yes" below!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pace

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution !
customer_reviews.text: I just received my retainers and tried them on my glasses. They are the perfect solution for the slipping I was experiencing. They fit tight on the frames and do not cause any discomfort on my ears. I wear thin wire frame glasses and I did not experience any of the problems the other reviewers experienced. The ear pieces fit tight and did not slip at all. I have used the retainers with a tail and did not like the tail rubbing on my neck, so these retainers are a great solution to my problem. I recommend them and I will be buying more of them.
customer_reviews.author: BIGFOOT

customer_reviews.title: Chumming!
customer_reviews.text: When I had gotten this in, I was quite skeptical how to put it on. The ends have some thick thing that is pretty hard to push through. But when you get pass it, it will hold onto it VERY well. I bought this to ride onto roller coasters. More specifically, Six Flags Magic Mountain. They have crazy roller coasters and all the rides, the product held onto the glasses like nothing! Try not to buy this if you have thin frames though, it will most likely slip off!
customer_reviews.author: MeowBarkMoo

customer_reviews.title: Not meant to be tight on the head.
customer_reviews.text: It seems people thought this would be an athletic type retainer that fits snug on the head. This is not that, this is an alternative to regular chums that hang with a tail. I got a free pair of regular one though a promotion but didn't want the tailor my everyday glasses so I put them on my raybans. These are perfect for my everyday pair as they keep close to my head with out a tail flailing around. The one down side was the ends were very tight but somehow I got them to go over my odly shaped tips of my glasses. Very good product if you get past the minute flaws. Love chums.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15 year old to use on his eye glasses so they don’t fall off while playing basketball. They work perfectly! I believe they are a bit pricey for what they are but work really well and are sturdy. He has had them for over 5 months now and they are still strong. I just wash them when they need to be washed and color has faded a bit but work as day 1!
customer_reviews.author: S. Philip

customer_reviews.title: Insufficiently Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers note that these can be adjusted so that glasses are held snugly to the face. (When I write "snugly," I mean just sufficiently tight so that glasses don't bounce while jogging.) My experience has been the opposite. The without-a-tail product I received cannot be adjusted to hold my glasses snugly to my face. The Chums with a "tail" adjust just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ira M. Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Greatfor Sports
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hold my glasses to my head as I played intramural soccer, and this product did it well. Now I even use it to go for my daily runs. I didn't realize that I wasn't getting the most out of my running experience until I used this product to hold my glasses. It's a bit cheesy, but now I actually enjoy outdoor running because I can see nature all around me. Pros: - soft, quality material - easily adjustable - washable Cons: - a little too tight sometimes Overall: 5/5. This product works well. It's easy to attach it to a pair of glasses, and it creates a snug, comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: fits small glasses
customer_reviews.text: I got these Chums adjustable eyewear retainer for my 7 yr old dd. She just started taking gymnastics and her glasses kept falling off.o These fit her small glasses just fine and have been staying put. At it's smallest setting it is still too big for her head, so I just tied a knot in the middle of it to shorten it up a bit and now it fits her fine. The only thing I don't like about it is it's a little thick and somewhat unsightly to me. However, since I got the black, and her hair is dark, it is barely noticeable from a a few feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Linh L.

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive pair of eye glasses holders that didnt look too stupid. I am not willing to pay too much for a decorative one with someones advertising on it unless it is free. This one works well and is inexpensive. It looks decent too. I use for my sunglasses.Would reorder.
customer_reviews.author: ClayTheMan

customer_reviews.title: Good in Most, but Not All Situations
customer_reviews.text: Looked great.liked having no tail. Wasn't tight enough. I use my sunglass retainers in the surf and have used 6 different brands and models. I love Chums, but the first wave rinsed my prrscription sunglasses off my head and I lost them forever - retainer eiher wasn't tight enough or couldn't be positioned securely. However, these would be great in most other situations
customer_reviews.author: P. Bohning

customer_reviews.title: Neat, simple, durable
customer_reviews.text: Unless you fancy the 'monkey tail' look of regular adjustable eyeglasses retainers, these are a perfect alternative. Soft fabric, readily adjustable, don't slip, a wide variety of colors, and a clever, but simple design for a neater look. I bought one to try and as soon as it arrived, immediately bought 5 more in other colors. It will arrive in the shortest position. Pull on the longer ends to extend to whatever length you want-- don't pull on the plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory. Needed to keep from losing my glasses. ...
customer_reviews.text: Satisfactory. Needed to keep from losing my glasses. I have two pair, one for distance and the other for reading, and can't combine them into a single unit. Without these retainers, I keep losing them and having to purchase replacements. One negative--the straps can get a bit uncomfortable if they get wet. And when wearing two at the same time, they tend to get tangled up with each other. But that is also a problem with other types of retainers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I got these to prevent my glasses from flying off on roller coasters at six flags. They hold the glasses pretty well, but not close to the head like i was hoping. I will point out, that even on the high thrill coasters, never once did my glasses try to come off. So i didn't really need this in the first place. It was nice for peace of mind though.
customer_reviews.author: Selina Mularz

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Oakley Flak-Jacket Sunglasses without an Issue
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on my Oakley Flak-Jacket Sunglasses and it fits perfectly. However, in order to have the perfect fit, I needed to remove the cushions and slide the product all the way up the frame until it got to the thickest part of the glasses. Mind you I have a large heard, but I still had more than enough room to get this product around my head and have it fit snugly. I really put this product to the test when I went White Water Rafting and they did not disappoint! I love this product and will continue to use them to keep my expensive pair of sunglasses sage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Magda

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit my glasses very well.
customer_reviews.text: The ends don't really fit well on my glasses--it's very easy to pull or knock them off. The strap that came with my (prescription) sport glasses is a little too snug, even fully extended, so I thought I'd try these. I probably won't continue to use them unless I can figure out an easy way to put them on and take them off. STP
customer_reviews.author: Stephen T. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Way too loose, even for my larger than average head.
customer_reviews.text: The one I got was way too loose even for a large head. I had to tighten it as tight as it would go and still needed to tie a knot in it to prevent my glasses from falling off when bending over working on things. I read the review from someone with a small head and figured I wouldn't have that problem, but I did. Wherever it was made they must have heads the size of large watermelons. I'll keep them only because it's a bigger hassle to return them than it's worth and I was able to jerry-rig it, However, leaving an ugly knot at the back of my head.
customer_reviews.author: LoneRanger

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but not adjustable enough
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something specific to secure my glasses under my riding helmet while I ride horses. This is a great idea, but failed because they are not sufficiently adjustable. I have a “small” skull so my glasses still felt a bit loose. That said they might work for others.
customer_reviews.author: pb

customer_reviews.title: Good as ever, and better looking without the tail hanging out.
customer_reviews.text: Finally! No more rat tail hanging out looking goofy, or getting tangled up in my collar. Easy to put on, and more discreet. With aging eyes, I now have 3 pairs of eye glasses (for driving, for computer work, and sunglasses). They all have different style ear pieces. These fit 2 of the pairs, (very thin and medium size). A competitive brand of eye glass retainer just fits one of the three sizes (very large).
customer_reviews.author: GC0110

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE LOOSE FITTING GLASSES!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband because he has plastic frames for his glasses. It is so hot in Texas that when he works outside, his glasses are constantly falling down or off his face because he is perspiring. There is an adjustment on the back that allows a perfect fit to your head. Make sure you measure your frames at the largest part because I ordered an XL for his glasses and they fit perfectly. We ride motorcycles so even though the wind is blowing from all directions, the Chums hold his glasses on and he isn't afraid they will blow off his face.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Cool design, work well
customer_reviews.text: Really decent style. They fit over my bulky ear-ends, and slid on and hold securely on the metal stems. I am not sure of the official terminology for eyeglass parts and I am too lazy to search google at this time. Point is I bought these because other ones would not fit over the ear ends, and these fit under a helmet. Some adjustment to getting them off and on, but I think that is minor.
customer_reviews.author: ajar

customer_reviews.title: Use them everyday - so thankful to have them!
customer_reviews.text: Doing a landscaping project this season so I'm outside moving around a lot. My glasses were constantly slipping down my nose and I was constantly adjusting them. I ordered a half dozen chums, different color designs for different occasions. Plus, working outside like I have been I knew they will get dirty quickly so I wanted extras, like having a fresh change of clothes. They are so functional. My glasses are secure and fit better than ever. I no longer have to be adjusting through out the day. These chums are a fantastic! Great color designs, too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS, as I'm always afraid I'm going to lose my glasses while walking!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS, as I'm always afraid I'm going to lose my glasses while walking! I dislike the feeling of the strap on my neck hanging down and flapping as I walk, but it's a small price to pay for security of my glasses. I love how I can lengthen the piece that holds onto the glasses! I bought some fasteners to create my own straps, but I haven't started those yet.
customer_reviews.author: Beyond Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good, will fit most Sunglasses (including Ray-Ban Wayfarer 2140)
customer_reviews.text: These retainers feel very good. The will fit most Sunglasses. I tried use them with Ray-Ban Wayfarer 2140 model and work nice. It's a bit hard to get them in, but that ensures they won't loose easily. The adjustable strap could be better. It's a bit hard to regulate once you put your glasses on, and you need both hands to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas C.

customer_reviews.title: They are very adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: These retainers fit well and ARE adjustable. If your glasses have thin over ear pieces, you may have to put some adhesive tape around them to make the retainers stay put. I use aviator glasses and I have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lee C. Morris III

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get over the end of the glasses but probably good to keep it from slipping off. Overall works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lawdog1404

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was glad to find these no-tail sunglasses strap for keeping my shades safely on me when paddleboarding. So far so good! The materal is soft, and I didn't really notice them. And they fit well on my Ray-Ban New Wayfarers.
customer_reviews.author: LARK

customer_reviews.title: Chums.
customer_reviews.text: Chums need I say more these are great I need two pairs of glasses bifo 's and sunglasses. So when I am out and about I do not have to go fishing in my bag for the other pair of glasses you see I need a special lens for my reading and they can not use that lens in my sunglasses so there you go. I highly recommend these There are different ones even floating ones for swimming. You don't even know you are wearing them. Good product Get a few to match outfits ! Really
customer_reviews.author: pam shea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Roller Coasters!
customer_reviews.text: Used this puppy to ride roller coasters at Cedar Point in Ohio and they didn't budge!!! I have prescription glasses so this was really important for me on roller coasters!
customer_reviews.author: hannahschob

customer_reviews.title: No more allergic reactions
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I used to get itching and burning behind my ears from wearing glasses. Now that the arms of the glasses are covered with these cotton covers, all the itching is gone. It's soft and natural and won't give you an allergic reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Simpleton

customer_reviews.title: Quality glasses strap.
customer_reviews.text: I looked dorky but who cares. My glasses stayed on for every ride not budging once. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Helpy Helperton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t tighten enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t tighten enough for what I wanted. Now it’s sitting in a box somewhere. I’ll probably gift them to someone later that’ll use it without it being tight.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: doesn't hold my safety glasses
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to grab my safety glasses from sliding off my head when I'm sweating and leaning over working on something, but they will not adjust in far enough to grab the back of my head. They just loosely bounce up and down behind my head. I don't really see what these are designed for if not for that kind of purpose. Maybe you have a different purpose. If so then don't take this review serious. Try for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: FushigiMigi

customer_reviews.title: I have retainers on all my sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: These hold my extra large frames securely and are soft on my neck both when I am wearing my sunglasses or when I walk inside and hang them from my neck. I believe they have saved me from losing my beloved sunglasses many times over. It also means I don't have to carry the case and take up precious room in my purse/bag to keep them safe.
customer_reviews.author: Terri S

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, but it slips off the glasses too easily
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for a couple of months. It pretty much does what I want, but I do have a problem with the little rubber ends that are supposed to grip the ear pieces on your eyeglass frames ("earpieces" is probably the wrong word, but I don't know what else to call them). The grip isn't very tight, and the frames sometimes slip out of the rubber holders. I have not yet had an incident where my glasses fell on the floor, but this is a distinct possibility.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Where'd my glasses go?
customer_reviews.text: I usually pop my shades on top of my head when not using them and after purchasing an expensive pair of glasses I was worried about them sliding off and braking. This was my solution. They work perfectly, but I didn't like the over all look so I took 'em off. They do work very well though and I will keep 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Dalekfodder

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit Small Melons
customer_reviews.text: Like others here, these are just too big for my 7 1/4 sized head. They look nice, and would be fine for hanging my specs around my neck, but I need retainers that can cinch up to keep my glasses tight during hard physical activity. The Croakies Micro Suiters work much better for me, but I'll hold on to these as backups.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well comfortable. Used daily and washed them in the shower. They did fade a little after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: N. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work for my prescription Oakley frames
customer_reviews.text: Bought these hoping they'd secure my prescription Oakley sports frames during basketball, but it's a big hassle to even get these on. My frames have rubber ends to keep the frames from coming off. I wanted extra support in case I get whacked in the head. These dont really work on the frames because of that rubber. If I push hard enough to slip the retainers on, it'll crinkle the rubber upwards towards the lenses. I've only tried to use these a few times, they'll work better for non-rubberized ends.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Effective, could be more durable
customer_reviews.text: I do gymnastics/acrobatics and these allow me to see while flipping...they don't fall off and work rather well with my plastic frames. Simple and effective. EDIT: After two-three months the color has visibly worn from black to a rust-like hue. Also starting to fray and bloat. Still fulfills its general purpose though I would have liked it to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good, Solid Hold
customer_reviews.text: This retainer is just what I wanted. However, my head is quite small, so the tail still hangs down behind my head. But, I do like the way it fits my sun glasses; it sure isn't going to come off or let them fall out. Nice and snug. The little bit that hangs down does not bother me.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. McCormick

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my safety glasses where they need to be; connected to me, not on the bench, floor, truck, customers attic..........you get the point. I like the cloth feel and the adjustability of these.
customer_reviews.author: Builder9

customer_reviews.title: Not for standard frames
customer_reviews.text: Lost an $80 pair of sunglasses because of these. Was expecting them to maintain a hold on my glasses while they were around my neck. The glasses which were properly installed, fell out of the retainer and into the ocean while sailing. They probably work alright if the arms on the sunglasses are huge.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: No lost sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: I got these to hold my Oakley fives squared on my neck during a white water rafting trip and they worked prefect. They slid on the ends which are a little wider than the rest of the shaft and held them on my face the whole 3 hours. I decided to also try them zip lining in Mexico and once again they were snug as a bug in a rug. Still haven't lost my Oaks.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Mullins

customer_reviews.title: good product, works well
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is great because it's soft on the neck, and when it gets wet it dries out quickly, seemingly none the worse for wear. The adjustment mechanism works well. The grippers that hold the stems of the glasses work OK, but they seem to have less grip now than when they were new (a few months). The overall length is almost too short for me, but at maximum extension it's about right (admittedly I have a big head).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: My infant son is at the stage where he likes to grab my hair and/or eyeglasses when I carry him. While I can put my hair back, my eyeglasses were a harder issue to solve until I got these. They're comfortable and do the trick keeping my glasses in place. My only nitpick is that they are slightly too large for my head even on the smallest adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: mform85

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product, however the description said small/med, however they were still way too big. I'm female with a smaller head, but not the size of a child. So they won't be a solution for keeping my glasses on while riding roller coasters.
customer_reviews.author: tiffers

customer_reviews.title: Work great for gymnastics!
customer_reviews.text: I have Lacoste thick rim-glasses (with a bend around the ear) and these work GREAT! I went to a gymnastics gym last week and these held my glasses to my face without any issues at all! Doing flips on trampolines and highbars proved to be no problem. The only time my glasses got jarred is when I jumped into the foam pit and a bunch of foam blocks hit me in the face. My glasses did not fall off my face, however. I actually forgot they were attached to my glasses for a while. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sumofty

customer_reviews.title: Great Product; Great Price & Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to wear at the amusement park. These are great and kept his glasses on all summer. In fact I ordered these while standing in line, and they arrived quickly and as ordered. The only issue, albeit minor, was my husband's sunglasses have a flared end piece that made putting these on them the first time a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Didnt fit on my glasses
customer_reviews.text: My glasses didn't fit in the holders. Very disappointed, you'd expect the opening to accommodate a regular pair of glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Too long - won't keep glasses from slipping
customer_reviews.text: These retainers do not serve the purpose of keeping eyeglasses from falling down your nose since the minimum adjustable length is way more than the ear to ear distance on any human head. The only way I could use them is to twist the double strand before attaching the second side.
customer_reviews.author: Jasperdog

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the sunglasses where I need them...
customer_reviews.text: ...and keeps the earpieces from pressing painfully on my head, too, an unexpected bonus. I need to remove my sunglasses often to do geocache searching, and I had almost lost my Rx pair. These are perfect for this purpose, much quicker and easier than having to put them in a pocket (I always wear a hat, so top of head not an option). Wish I had bought them sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Beege

customer_reviews.title: does not fit
customer_reviews.text: this is supposed to be adjustable, but even with my large head, i cannot get the band tight enough to hold my goggles on. i barely fit into regular hats, and it is even worse w my hair up, but even w a bun hairdo, this thing is too loose. andre the giant might have managed it. useless, therefore. glad i bought a croakies version also... at least that one is useful.
customer_reviews.author: rani

customer_reviews.title: safety glasses no longer slide down my face
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was having a problem at work with my safety glasses constantly sliding down my nose. These are perfect for safety glasses because 1) they prevent your glasses from sliding down, 2) there is no "tail" in the back hanging down which might get caught in something, and 3)even if the strap were to somehow get caught on something, it would simply slip off from the glasses with very little resistance. I will purchase this product again if the need for another ever arises!
customer_reviews.author: S. Sponaugle

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Fit on Goggles with Rubber Tips
customer_reviews.text: These might be very nice, but I surely don't know. I bought them to wear with my bicycling goggles, but try as I might, using fingers and needle-nose pliers, I couldn't slip the ends more than a half-inch onto my goggles. The rubber tips on my goggle temples created too much friction. The instruction DO NOT EAT, was kind of interesting. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say?! These are Chums, same as they ever were, hold your glasses on and the natural cotton won't damage your frames or irritate your neck the way other brands can. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Drago

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I really love the No Tail Chums. I had Chums before and always thought they are a great product. They hold glasses well and make it convenient to let them hang from your neck. With the No Tail design you're able to enjoy the same product without the additional little tail hanging out which can be annoying on your neck. They work well, and adjust easily to any size you want.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Not adjustable enough
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to use these to hold my sunglasses on while riding a bicycle. They are not elastic so the only way you're going to get a decent/tight fit is to slide the adjusters. I have a large head and have slid the adjusters as far as they can go and they're still too loose. I guess I should have read the negative reviews first. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: SecondRound

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: These No Tail Chums are the best type of this product I've used. The Chums are more durable than Croakies and offer a much tighter fit on the sunglasses. The no-tail feature is especially nice if you want to keep your sunglasses from falling off of you but also don't want to look like you have a rat tail. They take a little extra effort to get them on sunglasses with rubber earpiece tips, but it's worth it to know that these things are not letting go.
customer_reviews.author: JaMiracle

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit
customer_reviews.text: I recently broke off the hooks(?) that goes around your ear because it was very irritating. This did the job perfectly as it made my glasses not fall off while being very comfortable. Would buy again if I ever have to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great sunglass retainer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this retainer to replace one that was just too stiff. This retainer appears to be made of high quality components and is very sturdy. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: so perfect to keep the glasses from falling off or even ...
customer_reviews.text: Built well and does the job. My glasses hang right where I want them to when these retainers are at their fullest extension, so they are not too long. When wearing glasses and these are snug at their tightest, they rest just against the back of my neck, so perfect to keep the glasses from falling off or even sliding off your nose.
customer_reviews.author: Slim Portly

customer_reviews.title: chums no tail retainer
customer_reviews.text: If your sun or regular glasses are much like my Oakley sun glasses where you have a rubber end sleeves on the glasses....this product will not work for them....the glasses must be all plastic in order to work the ends of the retainer over the sun glass arms... I just gave this one away to and nearest stranger... live & learn....
customer_reviews.author: METL HD

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put on my sunglasses.. maybe the ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put on my sunglasses .. maybe the arms on my glasses are too big but I really had to fight to get them on far enough to stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Irene A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have use the tail version for about 20 years. So glad they came out with the No Tail, I also like that it blends with my hair color.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to adjust the length with a bit of sewing. Luv em!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: but these are great and have never slid off the earpiece
customer_reviews.text: I keep these on my sunglasses all the time. I've had issues in the past with similar products, but these are great and have never slid off the earpiece. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chaps

customer_reviews.title: No frills, but saves your sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for anyone going to a theme park, riding on a motorcycle, boat, etc. I have used this in all three of these situations and I can't count how many times they have saved my sunglasses from disappearing forever. This set fits well, and works great with three different pairs of sunglasses that I own, including one with fairly wide ear pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: "no tail",is the reason
customer_reviews.text: I bought these retainers and have truly enjoyed the fact that they are adjustable from loose to tight.With the proper adjustment to your use,they will roll with your movements and stay in place without any excess flapping around the back of your neck.These are smartly constructed and I encourage anyone to try them/.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus95928

customer_reviews.title: Durable  And swim safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these wondering if they would actually work. But they proved to be very good in the water while swimming. Easily cleanable, and can be wrung out after water usage . Very adaptable and adjustable to fit
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for windy days
customer_reviews.text: After a wind gust blew my hat, headphones, sun glasses and eye glass off during one of our southern New Mexico periodic windy days..the $38 poly carbonate sun glasses got badly scratched, so when I got a new pair, this eyewear retainer was perfect and I have worn it ever day since the accident and it works and looks great. Thanks for the perfect answer to my problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ford Ballard, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmmm
customer_reviews.text: Made the switch to this set up as my others kept falling off. Even though I like these a lot more they still pop off. Going to try to put tape on the ends to try to fill the void
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chums No Tail
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these specifically because I did not want the type with the "Tails" hanging down hitting you on the back of your neck. However when the two were shipped, I got one which was the correct type and one like I did not want. The correct one works great, but they need to improve on quality control and send what is ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Romans12 2

customer_reviews.title: Thick Cotton
customer_reviews.text: It's cotton so will get sweaty. It's also very thick so you can definitely feel it. I did buy it for running and biking and better option would be getting something for working out, but does fit larger frames
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: not adjustable enough!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works, but you can't tighten it all the way to your head, so it will still hang loosely behind you unless your head is very large. Actually my boyfriend tried it as well and his head is on the large side, so your head would have to be enormous. If you want that fabric dangling behind your head then this is probably a 5 star product for you, but what's the point of it being adjustable if you can't tighten it all the way snug?
customer_reviews.author: Walt Gorecki

customer_reviews.title: Works very good with thick temples
customer_reviews.text: Good design, quality, and material. Keeps glasses in place. May slip out from skinny or wire temples.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great. 5 stars if I can get a synthetic blend. Cotton retains too much mositure.
customer_reviews.author: Galt, J.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend them for sun glasses for sure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for regular eye glasses. They don't stay on the thinner frames as well and they make my ears poke out. I would recommend them for sun glasses for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin  J Surber

customer_reviews.title: These work well.
customer_reviews.text: These work well. The material is elastic to stay attached to the glasses, so it is also a bit thick, you will notice that in the feel of your glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Pj Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but I don't like the fact that when you wear this the neck ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but I don't like the fact that when you wear this the neck portion collects the sweat from your skin and get white and looks dirty
customer_reviews.author: Andre laing

customer_reviews.title: for big heads
customer_reviews.text: I use these on sunglasses to keep a tight fit on my head when biking. These do the trick but then can be tricker to put on and off. They are very comfortable though and really work well. PROS: -comfy material -slip on hard plastic material easily -work well CONS: -fits larger heads-I had to push the ends almost all the way to the front of the glasses (and I have a big head) -harder to remove put on than the behind the head draw string type -not an elastic stretch band. You cannot fit it to your head and hold with some elastic force.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband's work safety glasses. He loved it so much that he used it on his normal (wire framed) glasses so I had to order another one for his safetys which have thick plastic arms. This fits well on both styles and they are both used every day. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: OK only
customer_reviews.text: I ended up going back to a more traditional strap after having this one for a while. Worst problem - the sun fades it really fast and it looks like crap after a few months. No other sunglass strap I've had ever did this. Also on my Oakleys it was hard to install over the rubber end tips.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pick

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose. Works well. Only "issue" is ...
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose. Works well. Only "issue" is if u adjust it while it's on it pinches your hair ladies. Worked well otherwise for whitewater rafting
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars because the holes are too small for my ...
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because the holes are too small for my glasses. They need to make the holes wider to fit larger shades.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too long. You can't snug your eyewear to your ...
customer_reviews.text: Too long. You can't snug your eyewear to your skull. The same item last year adjusted tight enough your glasses would not slide down your sweaty nose. Threw it out, too much effort to return an inexpensive item
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Guy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work well with my Sunglasses and the adjustment cord is somewhat unique!
customer_reviews.author: C. Harrell

customer_reviews.title: I like the style and usefullness but
customer_reviews.text: strings are made of materials that cause allergies. I like the style and usefullness but?
customer_reviews.author: Frez

customer_reviews.title: The straps work fine to keep a pair of glasses around the neck ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small child as it was listed in the children's section. The straps do not adjust small enough to secure the glasses to the face of a child, which was the reason for purchasing this product. The straps work fine to keep a pair of glasses around the neck for a child or adult and are easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Pasquale J. Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Works on Some Eyeglasses
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my eyeglasses with straight ear piece but will work on my other glasses with a curved earpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my glasses on my head
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. The ends a snug on the glasses and won't fall off. Have used them on jetskis and boating mostly, and haven't had any problems. They have been used for 1 boating season so far and they still appear new. I would recommend and buy another pair if needed.
customer_reviews.author: ggraple

customer_reviews.title: Not for smaller heads
customer_reviews.text: They don't adjust very easily so you better have a larger head.
customer_reviews.author: Anntexas

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they are great, especially for heavy prescription glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This product keeps my glasses on my nose so well. Because it doesn't have a tail I can wear it under my hair and no one can tell I have it on. I use it at work because I'm on a computer all day and my glasses are constantly falling off. Now that i have the strap, I can type to my heart's content.
customer_reviews.author: Britton

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that fits
customer_reviews.text: My large sunglasses. I love using these during summer when in and out so don't want to keep putting them in bag, for example at amusement parks. Just wish it floated so I could use at beach. Very pleased as they work for what I bought them for
customer_reviews.author: Hannajo

customer_reviews.title: Merely OK
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you are doing anything moderately physical; the fabric does not wick away sweat very well and discolors after a while. It is comfortable but it's not much better than the $2 elastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: JRMang

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for whitewater rafting. Was comfortable and did the job. I still have my glasses which is what I was going for. Reasonable price and quick and inexpensive delivery too.
customer_reviews.author: db1776

customer_reviews.title: Can't cinch up tight to head....
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more of the reviews before purchasing, will work great if only used to hang your glasses around your neck, but if you like to cinch the glasses up tight to your head for strenuous activity, then these will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: yes
customer_reviews.text: don;t loose your glasses. these are great. color is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

product_meta.title: Chums No Tail Adjustable Eyewear Retainer
product_meta.description: Chums No Tail Adjustable Eyewear Retainer includes an intense, active sports like kayaking and climbing require a secure retainer that fits under a helmet. This sunglass strap is perfect for those who prefer their CHUMS without a tail. Great for activities that require helmets it has a similar fit and feel.
feature_bullets: Small-end temple with dual bead adjustability
